brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the study is:

        -  to measure sensitization of the nociceptive system at patients with low back pain in
           order to carry out a necessary surgical procedure

        -  to examine a possible association between low back pain and degenerative changes

        -  to analyse if low back pain is related to the clinical result 6 months after surgery

        -  to set up a model for pre-operative measurement of pain.

clinical_study.brief_title: Qualitative Pain Measurement at Patients With Degenerative Low Back Pain

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  patients who are going to be treated surgically for spondylitis

          -  ability to understand Danish in order to filling in a questionnaire

          -  a written signed statement of consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  removal of implants

          -  diabetic neuropathy or another neuropathic disease

          -  neurological diseases

          -  unability to read or understand Danish

clinical_study.official_title: Qualitative Pain Measurement and Sensitization at Patients With Degenerative Low Back Pain With Indication for Lumbar Intervertebral Disc

authority: Denmark: The Danish National Committee on Biomedical Research Ethics

primary_outcome.description: On basis of the extended examinations of low back pain, we expect to achieve a better knowledge to measure pain at this category of patients before a possible surgical procedure.
primary_outcome.measure: Pain measured at lumbar area, hip and ankle by an algometer

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
clinical_study.why_stopped: Lack of patients with the right criteria for inclusion
